_header: The foremost of these beasts three
_description: Three dangerous beasts, the lion, the bear and the dragon, eleven to fifteen lines—mixed rhyme schemes, couplets and short lines abba (the first two lines not in Furnivall).

BLHar7322.First Lines: þe formest of þese bestres þreis worst of alle as tou mait se…
BLHar7322.Last Lines: …I wile ȝou alle swelewe wit outin oni lothdot some wile y saue & some wile y noth
BLHar7322.Note: Written as prose inserted into Latin, the couplets separated by Latin text
BLHar7322.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
